Problem:
Consider a control system where the state vector \\(x(t)\\) evolves according to the linear time-invariant system \\(\\dot{x} = Ax + Bu\\), with A and B being constant matrices and \\(u(t)\\) an input vector. We are interested in examining the effects of implementing an input transformation \\(u(t) = D v(t)\\), where D is a constant matrix and \\(v(t)\\) represents a new transformed input.

Given the endpoint \\(x(T)\\), can we precisely determine what input transformations were used (whether \\(D v(t)\\), \\(E w(t)\\), or both), strictly by knowing the state \\(x(T)\\)?
Explanation: Determining the specific input transformations used by only observing \\(x(T)\\) is challenging due to the overlapping effects that the matrices B, D, and E can have on the evolution. This makes it difficult to separate and identify which transformations were applied, especially if they share similar or complementary effects on the state trajectory.

The constant matrix A directly influences the evolution of the state vector x(t), while matrix B also affects x(t) through the input u(t).
